The DETFs can be classified depending on the genes that are being regulated and the effect they produce when expressed. Thus, it is not surprising that many of the DETFs regulate the transcription process itself. For example, TAF1A, MYBBP1A and PWP1 are involved in the assembly of RNA polymerase I preinitiation complex, processing of ribosomal RNA and ribosome assembly, respectively
46â€“ 48 . Similarly, EEF1A1 has been recognized as a translation elongation factor
49 . Interestingly all these genes appear to increase their expression at day 1 and are still upregulated, but at a lower level at day 3. This suggests that the injury triggers an early response to establish the transcription machinery necessary for the subsequent regenerative processes.
